channel.title: A free software resolution
channel.description:
The geekier of my new years resolutions: "Be less of a hypocrite when it comes to free software". I tend to advocate pragmatism rather than fundamentalism, my main explanation being "I do what I can". That's not really true, though, I still use a shit ton of locked in formats, proprietary codecs, software that I COULD replace without a massive amount of inconvenience.
So 2011 is the year of doing a lot more for free software, for Mopman. I'm going to start by abolishing [i]all[/i] binary blobs and the proprietary software that I can easily do without. The stuff that at the moment I can't do without (for example, audio) I'm going to continue using for now, but balance that karma out by contributing to free projects with the eventual goal of being able to switch to them.
WHO'S WITH ME?
Kekeke...

item.title: A free software resolution
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Linux is generally annoying.

Read full topic

item.title: A free software resolution
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Unfortunately I was mistaken about there being a free driver available for my card (fucking ATI :P) so I guess I can’t free my kernel until I get round to buying another card and buy more carefully.

Still, plenty to work on. Annoying, though.

Read full topic

item.title: A free software resolution
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

One thing that has always bugged me because it kinda feels outside of our control is the binary blobs in the kernel. I’m not sure what the best way to handle that is, so I’m going to install GNewSense and see if I can live with being a bit behind. If not, then I’ll have to think of some other option, but I think it will be ok (fucking roll on GNewSense 3 though, do want)

Read full topic

item.title: A free software resolution
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I like it.

As for me though, besides the nvidia driver, and perhaps a few games here and there, I can’t think of anything I use on a regular basis that isn’t FOSS. Not really because I think I’m contributing to a better world, but just because I can’t find better tools anywhere else.

So what do you use that isn’t FOSS that you want to replace?

Read full topic

item.title: A free software resolution
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

A useful and informative contribution, cunt. :>

Read full topic

item.title: A free software resolution
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Nah.

Free software and open formats will sell themselves to me, if they’re good. If they’re not, then they won’t. I wouldn’t stop using something just because it isn’t open for something that isn’t as good, just because it is open 'n free.

Read full topic

item.title: A free software resolution
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Maybe still a little.

Read full topic
